meanings.definition: The act of abandoning or neglecting something.
meanings.sent1: The dereliction of his duties led to chaos in the office.
meanings.sent2: The dereliction of the old building made it unsafe to enter.
meanings.sent3: Despite his dereliction of watering the plants, they somehow survived.
meanings.sent4: The dereliction of the playground transformed it into a ghostly place.
meanings.sent5: Her dereliction of feeding the fish resulted in their unfortunate demise.

meanings.definition: The state of being abandoned or neglected.
meanings.sent1: The dereliction of the house was evident from the overgrown garden.
meanings.sent2: The dereliction of the park made it a haven for stray animals.
meanings.sent3: The dereliction of the forgotten toy brought a smile to the child's face.
meanings.sent4: The dereliction of the once-bustling street left it eerily silent.
meanings.sent5: The dereliction of the neglected library saddened the book lovers.
